title: Ranveer Singh & Alia Bhatt’s Gully Boy Wins Best Film Honour At Asian Academy Creative Awards
text:
Apna Time Aa Gaya! The one line that kept everyone hooked this year from Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt starrer Gully Boy. The movie which is India’s official entry for Oscars 2019, is making quite a lot of buzz already.

The Zoya Akhtar directorial has just bagged the best film from India award in the regional finals at the Asian Academy Creative Awards ceremony.

Farhan Akhtar expressed happiness over the victory and congratulated the entire team in a tweet. "Gully Boy wins the best film from India in the regional finals of the Asian Academy Creative Awards. Congratulations team," he wrote.

Don't Miss 1.7 K SHARES 388 SHARES 2.4 K SHARES 148 SHARES

The film, which drew inspiration from the lives of real-life rappers Divine and Naezy starred Ranveer and Siddhant Chaturvedi in the roles. Alia played the role of an aspiring medical student in the movie. Gully Boy also starred Kalki Koechlin and Vijay Raaz in prominent roles.

Apart from the Zoya Akhtar-directorial film, Netflix's Delhi Crime, also bagged several awards in various categories. Actor Shefali Shah won Best Actor in a leading role award followed by Richie Mehta for Best Direction and Best Original Screenplay, Beverley Mills for Best Editing and Best Original Programme by a streaming service.

"So so proud of #DelhiCrime," she tweeted.

Delhi Crime is based on the 2012 Delhi gang-rape case that took place in the neighbourhood of Munirka, in South Delhi. The series follows the story in the aftermath of the gang rape, where Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), Vartika Chaturvedi (Shefali Shah) is tasked to find the culprits, responsible for the assaults and death of the female victim.

With inputs from ANI
description: ‘Tu nanga hi toh aaya hai, kya ghanta lekar jaega?’ The one line that kept everyone hooked this year from Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt starrer Gully Boy, the movie which is India’s official entry for Oscars 2019, is making quite a lot of buzz already. The Zoya Akhtar directorial has just bagged the best film from India award in the regional finals at the Asian Academy Creative Awards ceremony.
